benchmark_details.name: SUBSPEC (Substitute Speculative Decoding)
benchmark_details.overview: SUBSPEC is a novel lossless and training-free technique designed to maximize inference throughput for offloaded large language models (LLMs) on consumer-grade devices. It constructs highly aligned draft models to effectively mitigate the latency due to parameter offloading, enabling competitive inference speeds with substantial speedups.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To accelerate inference of large language models on consumer GPUs with limited memory by proposing a new method for speculative decoding.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The minimum GPU memory requirement is approximately 7.1GB for Qwen2.5 7B, which may restrict the model layers that can remain GPU-resident compared to alternative methods.

data.source: Quantized substitute layers generated from offloaded target LLM portions and shared GPU layers.

methodology.calculation: For throughput, tokens per second are measured across various drafts and configurations.
methodology.interpretation: Higher average acceptance lengths and throughput indicate better efficiency in LLM inference.
methodology.baseline_results: SubSpec achieves up to 12.5× speedup compared to baseline offloading inference.
methodology.validation: Empirical validation through extensive benchmarking with diverse models and tasks.
